course_title: Special Topics: Content Marketing Digital Age
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 28 / Seats Avail: 14Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
This course is useful for anyone that needs to present to a stakeholder, whether that's marketer to consumer, consultant to client or entrepreneur to investor. We live in an increasingly noisy world and becoming a compelling storyteller is your best chance to break through.
We will explore how to make ideas sticky using examples ranging from Hollywood scripts to brands with cult like status (Glossier/Tesla/Liquid Death). Once we build a foundation for becoming effective communicators, we'll examine the creator economy that is fueling the biggest digital platforms of the day (FB/IG/TikTok/Email).
prerequisites: This section is reserved for students in the One-Year or Two-Year MBA program.
sections: Class Nbr: 2198, Section #: 3261, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 11:30a-12:45p, Instructor: M. Cooley, Status: Open
